title: Nearby Section - Within 25 Miles of Ballpark(s)
custom_preconds:
Given Location Services are enabled on the device
And we have launched the app
And we have navigated to the Ballpark Picker
custom_expected: Then stadiums will appear at the top above the All Teams section

custom_steps_separated.content: When there are stadiums within 25 miles from a user's location
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see all ballparks within 25 miles displayed at the top of the ballpark picker
And the ballparks will have a the distance from the ballpark (mi.) to the right of the ballpark name.

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the tester fakes the GPS to millburn NJ
And the user refreshes the ballpark picker
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be displayed citi field and yankee stadium
And the user will see they are both just at 23/25 miles of the ballparks

title: Nearby Section - NOT Within 25 Miles of BallPark(s)
custom_preconds:
Given Location Services are enabled on the device
And the user has navigated to the Ballpark Picker
custom_expected:
Then the Nearby section will not be visible
And all 30 ballparks will show under 'All Teams'

custom_steps_separated.content: When there are no teams within 25 miles of the user's current location
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see all teams listed in alphabetical order
And the user will not see any ballparks with the distance listed (mi.)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the tester fakes gps to summit NJ
And the user refreshes the ballpark picker
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be just outside 25 miles from Citi field
And the user will only see Yankee stadium at 24 miles

title: Ballparks Section
custom_preconds:
Given Location Services are enabled on the device
And the user has navigated to the Ballpark Picker
custom_expected:
Then ballparks will be displayed in alphabetical order by team name (ex. Philadelphia Phillies, Pittsburgh Pirates..)
And appear underneath the "All Teams" header

custom_steps_separated.content: When the remaining ballparks that are not in the "Nearby Ballparks" list are displayed
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see them listed out in alphabetical order based on state names

title: Index is Scrollable
custom_preconds: Given the user has navigated to the Ballparks Picker
custom_expected: Then the user will be able to scroll either up or down on the Ballpark list

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user flicks up &/or down
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the ballpark picker should scroll up or down
And the scrolling should be smooth
And the scroll should end on the Washington Nationals with the entire cell displayed in full

title: All Cells are Tappable
custom_preconds: Given the user has navigated to the Ballparks Picker
custom_expected:
Then the associated ballpark summary page for that cell will opened

*Repeat for each ballpark*

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on any of the cells in the list
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should be directed to either the ballpark guide page or ticket dashboard based on the ballpark config
(http://qa.mlb.com/gen/hb/ballpark/8/ballpark.json or http://mlb.mlb.com/gen/hb/ballpark/8/ballpark.json)
The logic should be if the position is not set on any of the sub navs it will default to the ballpark guide page

title: Location Refresh
custom_preconds: Given the user has navigated to the Ballparks Picker
custom_expected:
Then the app will relocate the user
And if needed, reorganize the ballparks based on the new location

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user's location has changed
And the user pulls down to refresh on the ballpark picker list
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the ballpark picker list should refresh
And the user should see the distance from some ballparks change
And the user should see the closest ballpark list remove or add based on the location change

title: Team Logos
custom_preconds: Given the user has navigated to the Ballpark Picker
custom_expected: Then all associated teams logo will display to the left of the venue name, and will all be completely visible against the background.

custom_steps_separated.content: When the stadiums are displayed in the list
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should see the latest or updated team logos displayed on the left side of ballpark name
and the logo should be encircled in white

title: Full Stadium Name & Team Name
custom_preconds: Given the user has navigated to the Ballpark Picker
custom_expected:
Then the full team names are displayed
And the stadium's full names are displayed beneath the full team name

custom_steps_separated.content: When the teams are displayed in the list
custom_steps_separated.expected:
The user should see the ballparks name in regular text directly underneath the clubs name
And both text will be aligned to the left

title: Dismissing Ballpark picker
custom_preconds: Given the user has launched the ballpark picker drop down
custom_expected:
Then the ballpark picker should collapse
And the user should be left on the team page from which they launched the ballpark picker.

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the team name in the top nav
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the ballpark picker list will retract the dropdown
And the user will be brought back to the view he was previously on before he triggered the dropdown

title: team picker
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the team/ballpark picker
custom_steps: For more Information on how the team picker sorts the ballparks check the linked ticket - https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/BPA-895

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is located within 25 miles of a ballpark_1
And the user has tickets to ballpark_2
And the user has favorited ballpark_3
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should see the following
- ballpark_1 should have a generic location icon directly below the ballpark name in its cell
- ballpark_2 should have a ticket icon directly below the ballpark name in its cell
- ballpark_3 should have a star icon directly below the ballpark name in its cell

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is located within 25 miles of a ballpark_1
And the user has tickets to ballpark_2
And the user has favorited ballpark_3
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should see the following at the top of the ballpark picker:
- ballpark_1(location) will always be displayed at the very top
- ballpark_2(ticket) will always be displayed directly below
- ballpark_3(favorite) will always be displayed directly below the ticket

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is located within 25 miles of a ballpark_1
And the user favorited ballpark_1
And the user has tickets to ballpark_1
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should see ballpark_1 located at the very top
And the user should see ballpark_1 with all 3 icons in a set order (based on the point system)
- location 1st
- ticket 2nd
- favorite 3rd

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user switches location while the ballpark picker is open
(fake GPS, in app teleport or actually moving to a different ballpark)
And the user refreshes the picker
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should see ballpark picker update location
And the user should see the ballpark that is closest to his/her current location

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user switches location while the ballpark picker is closed
(fake GPS, in app teleport or actually moving to a different ballpark)
And the user allows time for the device location to update
And the user opens the ballpark picker
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should see the ballpark picker display the new closest ballpark at the very topysre
(based on the score system)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is on any ballpark page
And the user opened the team picker
And the user tapped on the same button again
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should see the ballpark picker close
And the user should be brought back to the ballpark page he/she was on before
